firstH1.title: What is a strong password?
firstH1.firstLine: A strong password is one that is composed of a set of uppercase and lowercase characters, symbols and numbers, with a long length.
firstH1.secondLine: Currently, the recommended length is 12 characters, as many websites, such as Google or Amazon, claim that 8-character passwords with current technology can be guessed in a relatively short period of time.

secondH1.title: Why should you have one?
secondH1.firstLine: Having a strong password helps protect your account from malicious attacks.
secondH1.secondLine: In addition, intrusion or theft of digital identity will be avoided, 'spam' or other problems of access to data by third parties will be avoided.

ul.title: Some typical and easy-to-guess passwords can be the following:

li.first: Passwords that you have used before.
li.second: Passwords that contain any personal data of yours such as your name, surname, age...
li.third: Passwords with just common letters or words, for example 'dontenter'.
li.fourth: Passwords without symbols or proper length, for example 'pass12345'.

fourthH1.title: Why use this application?
fourthH1.firstLine: This application is specialized in generating and storing strong passwords.
fourthH1.secondLine: The generated passwords are created from certain data that you enter manually and can only be regenerated if said data is entered correctly.
fourthH1.thirdLine: For our part, our database will not save any password, making it even more difficult for anyone except you to generate or obtain it.

firstH1.title: What is a strong password?
firstH1.firstLine: A strong password is one that is composed of a set of uppercase and lowercase characters, symbols and numbers, with a long length.
firstH1.secondLine: Currently, the recommended length is 12 characters, as many websites, such as Google or Amazon, claim that 8-character passwords with current technology can be guessed in a relatively short period of time.

secondH1.title: Why should you have one?
secondH1.firstLine: Having a strong password helps protect your account from malicious attacks.
secondH1.secondLine: In addition, intrusion or theft of digital identity will be avoided, 'spam' or other problems of access to data by third parties will be avoided.

ul.title: Some typical and easy-to-guess passwords can be the following:

li.first: Passwords that you have used before.
li.second: Passwords that contain any personal data of yours such as your name, surname, age...
li.third: Passwords with just common letters or words, for example 'dontenter'.
li.fourth: Passwords without symbols or proper length, for example 'pass12345'.

fourthH1.title: Why use this application?
fourthH1.firstLine: This application is specialized in generating and storing strong passwords.
fourthH1.secondLine: The generated passwords are created from certain data that you enter manually and can only be regenerated if said data is entered correctly.
fourthH1.thirdLine: For our part, our database will not save any password, making it even more difficult for anyone except you to generate or obtain it.

h1.title: FORBIDDEN
h1.firstLine: You don't have permission to access / on this server.

h1.title: NOT FOUND
h1.firstLine: The resource requested could not be found on this server.

h1.title: INTERNAL SERVER ERROR
h1.firstLine: An internal server error has occured.

validationErrors.namePassExists: The password name entered already exists, choose another

validationErrors.dataValue: Enter a response that only contains numbers and letters and is 4 to 30 characters long
validationErrors.dataEmpty: You must enter the hints in order

text.h1: If you don't know how to use it press

text.firstLine: Remember that you will only be able to see the password at this time.
text.secondLine: If you wanted to see it again, you would have to enter the data again.

text.firstLine: There are no passwords to display!
text.secondLine: Please try again after generating a password.

recreatePasswordView.text: Fill in the fields that are not in yellow to regenerate the password

validationErrors.dataValue: Enter a hint that only contains numbers and letters and is 4 to 30 characters long

firstH2.title: Password name
firstH2.firstLine: In this field you will have to put the title of your password.
firstH2.secondLine: Note that two different passwords cannot have the same name.

secondH2.title: Password length
secondH2.text: In this field you will have to indicate the length of the password.

ul.title: Here you will have to choose between 3 options:

firstLi.title: Easy difficulty
firstLi.text: This difficulty will cause the password to contain only uppercase and lowercase letters.

secondLi.title: Medium difficulty
secondLi.text: With medium difficulty, what you will get is a password that contains uppercase and lowercase letters, and some numbers and symbols.

thirdLi.title: Difficult hard
thirdLi.text: Hard difficulty is the same as medium but increases the number of numbers and symbols.

fourthH2.title: Hints
fourthH2.firstLine: There are three equal fields that are called hints.
fourthH2.secondLine: These hints will be used to later recreate the password.
fourthH2.thirdLine: You will have to fill in at least one of them to generate a password.

ul.title: Each of the hints has two values:

firstLi.title: Hint
firstLi.firstLine: In this field you will have to indicate the name of the hint.
firstLi.secondLine: This name will be used as a clue to generate the same password again.

secondLi.title: Response
secondLi.text: It will be the answer that will be given to the question or clue to which the last value refers.
